page.title: 04THE FISHING INDUSTRY.
page.content: Although greatly decreased there is still a fishing industry in Sheringham. Catches are made at the following times in the year:- {crabs }March to October {lobsters }July and August {herrings} October and November {cod }January to March {rock salmon ) {plaice ) }Summer months {mackerel )} {whelks }All year (3-6 miles out). NUMBERS OF BOATS OVER LAST CENTURY:- 1880{26}luggers and{250}small boats. 1900{150}small inshore boats. 1920 {50} " " " 1940 {25} " " " 1960 {15} " " " 1980 {10} " " " 1985 {8}full-time and some part-time. Today full-time fishing costs{Â£11,000 to start for boat, gear and insurance.
